issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
running sbin/start-dfs.sh gives me a telling off about no null appender -should one be in the log4j config file.

Full trace (failure expected, but full output not as expected)
{code}
./start-dfs.sh 
log4j:ERROR Could not find value for key log4j.appender.NullAppender
log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate appender named "NullAppender".
Incorrect configuration: namenode address dfs.namenode.servicerpc-address or dfs.namenode.rpc-address is not configured.
Starting namenodes on []
cat: /Users/slo/Java/Hadoop/versions/hadoop-0.23.0/libexec/../etc/hadoop/slaves: No such file or directory
cat: /Users/slo/Java/Hadoop/versions/hadoop-0.23.0/libexec/../etc/hadoop/slaves: No such file or directory
Secondary namenodes are not configured.  Cannot start secondary namenodes.
{code}
fields.summary: no NullAppender in the log4j config

comments.body:
I see similar errors when running bin/hadoop, e.g.:

{noformat}
$ bin/hadoop jar hadoop-mapreduce-examples-0.23.0.jar pi \
-Dmapreduce.clientfactory.class.name=org.apache.hadoop.mapred.YarnClientFactory \
-libjars modules/hadoop-mapreduce-client-jobclient-0.23.0.jar 16 10000
log4j:ERROR Could not find value for key log4j.appender.NullAppender
log4j:ERROR Could not instantiate appender named "NullAppender".
{noformat}
Patch attached. Adds log4j.appender.NullAppender to log4j.properties .

+1, the patch looks good to me. I added those lines to my existing log4j.properties and it got rid of the error message.

Thanks a lot for doing this, Eli.

Thanks!
I meet this problem before and this patch works well for my hadoop cluster.
I've committed this and merged to 23.
